Package assignment1

Class Utility

java.lang.Object
assignment1.Utility
public class Utility extends Object
Utility class provides sorting algorithm methods. The utility class must sort a collection of Comparables (from instruction doc).

  • Method Details

    • sort

      public static <T extends Comparable<T>> void sort(String sortAlgorithm, T[] array, Comparator<? super T> comparator)
      Sorts the given array using the specified sorting algorithm and comparator.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the array, which must implement Comparable
      Parameters:
      sortAlgorithm - the sorting algorithm to use ('b' for bubble sort, 's' for selection sort, 'i' for insertion sort, 'm' for merge sort, 'q' for quick sort, 'z' for heap sort)
      array - the array to be sorted
      comparator - the comparator to determine the order of the array

    • mergeSort

      private static <T extends Comparable<T>> void mergeSort(T[] array, int low, int high, Comparator<? super T> comparator)
      Recursively sorts the given subarray using merge sort algorithm.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the array, which must implement Comparable
      Parameters:
      array - the array to be sorted
      low - the starting index of the subarray to be sorted
      high - the ending index of the subarray to be sorted
      comparator - the comparator to determine the order of the array

    • merge

      private static <T extends Comparable<T>> void merge(T[] array, int low, int mid, int high, Comparator<? super T> comparator)
      Merges two sorted subarrays into one sorted subarray.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the array, which must implement Comparable
      Parameters:
      array - the array to be sorted
      low - the starting index of the first subarray
      mid - the ending index of the first subarray
      high - the ending index of the second subarray
      comparator - the comparator to determine the order of the array

    • partition

      private static <T extends Comparable<T>> int partition(T[] array, int low, int high, Comparator<? super T> comparator)
      Partitions the given subarray around a pivot element.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the array, which must implement Comparable
      Parameters:
      array - the array to be sorted
      low - the starting index of the subarray
      high - the ending index of the subarray
      comparator - the comparator to determine the order of the array
      Returns:
      the index of the pivot element after partitioning

    • heapify

      private static <T extends Comparable<T>> void heapify(T[] array, int n, int i, Comparator<? super T> comparator)
      Converts a subtree rooted with node i into a max heap, assuming the subtrees are already heaps.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the array, which must implement Comparable
      Parameters:
      array - the array representing the heap
      n - the size of the heap
      i - the root index of the subtree to heapify
      comparator - the comparator to determine the order of the array
